sen.j: 忌み・斎み（いみ）とは
sen.e: What is imi (忌み or 斎み) ?
sen.cmt: 用例の訳文で漢字を使用していますので、その意味がわかるように、こちらにも括弧内に漢字の記述を加えました。
sen.e: What is imi (忌み or 斎み) ?
What is imi (忌み or 斎み) ?

sen.j: 神に対して身を清め穢れを避けて慎む事。
sen.e: To purify ourselves, avoid impurities, and be discreet to deities.
To purify ourselves, avoid impurities, and be discreet to deities.
To purify ourselves, avoid impurities, and be discreet to deities.

sen.j: 斎戒。
sen.e: Purification.
Purification.
Purification.

sen.j: （転じて）忌み避けるべきこと。
sen.e: (By extension) something that is tabooed.
(By extension) something that is taboo.
(By extension) something that is taboo.

sen.j: 禁忌。
sen.e: Taboo.
Taboo.
Taboo.

sen.j: はばかり。
sen.e: Restraint.
Restraint.
Restraint.

sen.j: 平安時代以降の用例は大半が2.の意。
sen.e: After Heian period, its examples are in the meaning of 2. in most cases.
After the Heian period, its examples are contained in the meaning of 2. in most cases.
After the Heian period, its examples are contained in the meaning of 2. in most cases.

sen.j: 概略
sen.e: Outline.
Outline.
Outline

sen.j: 基本的に生活圏に悪影響を及ぼすケガレを嫌い排除する事である。
sen.e: It is basically to dislike and eliminate the muck (impurity) that has a harmful effect on the living space.
It is basically to dislike and eliminate the muck (impurity) that has a harmful effect on the living space.
It is basically to dislike and eliminate the muck (impurity) that has a harmful effect on the living space.

sen.j: 台風や大雨、日照り、地震等自然災害も不浄、穢れとされ、地鎮祭など祓えの儀式で清められ治まるとされた。
sen.e: Natural disaster such as typhoon, heavy rain, drought, or earthquake was also considered as uncleanliness and impurity, and was purified and cleared up by a lustral ceremony such as ground-breaking ceremony.

Natural disasters such as typhoon, heavy rain, drought, or earthquake were also considered unclean impure, and were purified and cleared up through a lustral ceremony such as a ground-breaking ceremony.

Natural disasters such as typhoon, heavy rain, drought, or earthquake were also considered unclean impure, and were purified and cleared up through a lustral ceremony such as a ground-breaking ceremony.

sen.j: 神事における忌み
sen.e: Imi in Shinto rituals.
Imi in Shinto rituals.
Imi in Shinto rituals.

sen.j: 神宮等では、神事の際、忌火（いみび）と呼ばれる火を起こす。
sen.e: Fire called imibi is built inside Shrines during Shinto rituals.
Fire called imibi is built inside Shrines during Shinto rituals.
Fire called imibi is built inside Shrines during Shinto rituals.

sen.j: これは火がそもそも持つ性質、すなわち「他を焼き無くしてしまう」という性質が、一般的なケガレの概念、つまり「不浄」「不潔」同様、神や人間の結界、生活圏を脅かす「ケガレ」であるためである。
sen.e: It is because the nature of fire, that is to say, the property of 'to burn off others' is the 'muck' which threatens the barrier and living space of deities and human beings, just like general idea of muck, in other words, 'uncleanliness' or 'filth' is.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is because the nature of fire, that is to say, the property of 'to burn off others' is the 'muck' which threatens the barrier and living space of deities and human beings, just like general idea of muck, in other words, 'uncleanliness' or 'filth' is.
It is because the nature of fire, 'burning off others' which threatens the world of deities and living space of human beings, is 'impurity', just like general concept of 'uncleanliness' or 'filth'.
sen.cmt: NCのコメントを読み書き直しました。

sen.j: そのためこれを用いる際にそう呼ばれる。
sen.e: Therefore fire is called so when it is used this way.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore fire is called so when it is used this way.
Therefore fire is called so when it is used this way.

sen.j: また火がケガレを伝染媒介すると考えられてた為、かまどを別にするなどの措置がとられた。
sen.e: Also since fire was considered to carry the muck, measures to use separate furnaces were taken.
sen.cmt: 「考えられてた為」は「考えられていた為」の間違いと思われます。
sen.e: Also since fire was considered to carry the muck, measures to use separate furnaces were taken.
Also since fire was considered to carry the muck, measures to use separate ovens were taken.

sen.j: 古事記によるとイザナミは火の神（ホノカグツチノカミ）を産んだため陰所を焼かれた。
sen.e: According to Kojiki (The Record of Ancient Matters), Izanami was burned her private part for giving a birth to Kami of fire (Honokagutsuchinokami).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to Kojiki (The Record of Ancient Matters), Izanami was burned her private part for giving a birth to Kami of fire (Honokagutsuchinokami).
According to Kojiki (The Record of Ancient Matters), Izanami was burned her private part for giving a birth to Kami of fire (Honokagutsuchinokami).

sen.j: それが元で死に、黄泉の国に下る事になる。
sen.e: She died from this, and went down to yominokuni (realm of the dead).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She died from this, and went down to yominokuni (realm of the dead).
She died from this, and went down to yominokuni (realm of the dead).

sen.j: 「近き火、また恐ろし＜枕草子・せめておそろしきもの＞」や、現在でも「マッチ一本火事の元」という言葉にあるように、危険物として火は認識されてきた。
sen.e: Used in the words, 'Close fire is also dreadful <Makura no soshi (the Pillow Book, extremely dreadful things)>', or 'A match may cause a fire' at the present days, fire has been recognized as a dangerous thing.

Used in the words, 'Close fire is also dreadful <Makura no soshi (the Pillow Book, extremely dreadful things)>', or 'A match may cause a fire' at the present days, fire has been recognized as a dangerous thing.

Used in the words, 'Close fire is also dreadful <Makura no soshi (the Pillow Book, extremely dreadful things)>', or 'A match may cause a fire' at the present days, fire has been recognized as a dangerous thing.

sen.j: 忌み火をオリンピックの聖火と同一視される事があるが、火炎崇拝文化は神道にない。
sen.e: Imibi is sometimes identified with Olympic torch, but there is no culture to worship flames in Shinto.
sen.cmt: 「忌み火はオリンピックの聖火と同一視される事があるが」と解釈しました。
sen.e: Imibi is sometimes identified with the Olympic torch, but there is no culture to worship flames in Shinto.
Imibi is sometimes identified with the Olympic torch, but there is no culture to worship flames in Shinto.

sen.j: 本来神道における「火」はケガレである。
sen.e: Originally the 'fire' in Shinto is a muck.
Originally the 'fire' in Shinto is a muck.
Originally the 'fire' in Shinto is a muck.

sen.j: よってそれを押さえる火伏せの神様、火坊尊（ひぶせのみこと）などの神様が信仰の対象になって来た。
sen.e: Therefore deities preventing it such as Hibuse no kami (god of fire prevention) and Hibuse no mikoto have been worshipped.
Therefore deities preventing it such as Hibuse no kami (god of fire prevention) and Hibuse no mikoto were worshipped.
Therefore deities preventing it such as Hibuse no kami (god of fire prevention) and Hibuse no mikoto were worshipped.

sen.j: 鎮火（火を鎮める）という表現もある。
sen.e: There is also an expression, chinka (to extinguish fire).
There is also an expression, chinka (to extinguish fire).
There is also an expression, chinka (to extinguish fire).

sen.j: 例外もあるが、一般的に神道における死は穢れ（黒不浄）としての「忌み」である。
sen.e: There are exceptions, but generally death in Shinto is 'imi' as an impurity (kurofujo, or black impurity).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。黒不浄の定訳不明。
sen.e: There are exceptions, but generally death in Shinto is 'imi' as an impurity (kurofujo, or black impurity).
There are exceptions, but generally death in Shinto is 'imi' as an impurity (kurofujo, or black impurity).

sen.j: 神はそれを嫌うとされる。
sen.e: It is believed that deities hate it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is believed that deities hate it.
It is believed that deities hate it.

sen.j: よって神社内及び敷地内に遺体を持ち込んで葬儀をする事はない。
sen.e: Therefore people don't take deceased person's bodies and hold funerals inside shrines or on their premises.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore people don't take deceased person's bodies and hold funerals inside shrines or on their premises.
Therefore people don't take deceased person's bodies and hold funerals inside shrines or on their premises.

sen.j: 家庭の神棚は半紙を被せ神の目に触れないようにする。
sen.e: They cover household Shinto altar with hanshi (standard-size Japanese writing paper) so it won't reach deities' eyes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They cover household Shinto altar with hanshi (standard-size Japanese writing paper) so it won't reach the deities' eyes.
They cover household Shinto altar with hanshi (standard-size Japanese writing paper) so it won't reach the deities' eyes.

sen.j: 死（黒不浄）、経血（赤不浄）、出産（白不浄）は神様が嫌う不浄として避けられてきた。
sen.e: Death (kurofujo, or black impurity), menstrual blood (akafujo, or red impurity), and childbirth (shirofujo, or white impurity) had been considered as the impurities deities hated, and had been avoided.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。黒不浄、赤不浄、白不浄の定訳不明。
sen.e: Death (kurofujo, or black impurity), menstrual blood (akafujo, or red impurity), and childbirth (shirofujo, or white impurity) had been considered to be impurities hated by deities and had been avoided.

Death (kurofujo, or black impurity), menstrual blood (akafujo, or red impurity), and childbirth (shirofujo, or white impurity) had been considered to be impurities hated by deities and had been avoided.

sen.j: この価値観は明治政府の近代化及び富国強兵政策によって大きく変わる事になる。
sen.e: This value was widely changed by the modernization and policy of increasing wealth and military power by Meiji Government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This value was widely changed by the modernization and policy of increasing wealth and military power by Meiji Government.
This value was widely changed by the modernization and policy of increasing wealth and military power by Meiji Government.

sen.j: 戦死をケガレから名誉に、個人の問題であった出産を「産めよ増やせよ」の国家事業にした。
sen.e: Being killed in war was shifted from a muck to an honor, and the childbirth was shifted from a personal matter to the national project of ''Give birth to a lot of children and increase the population".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Being killed in war was shifted from a muck to an honor, and childbirth was shifted from a personal matter to a national project having the slogan of ''Give birth to a lot of children and increase the population".

Being killed in war was shifted from a muck to an honor, and childbirth was shifted from a personal matter to a national project having the slogan of 'Give birth to a lot of children and increase the population'.

sen.j: そしてそれを遂行する女性を褒めるという事に対応するため、これまでの穢れ観と正反対の価値観が神道において成立した。
sen.e: And to praise women for performing it, the new value opposite to the value of impurity came into existence in Shinto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And to praise women for performing it, a new value opposite the value of impurity came into existence in Shinto.
And to praise women for performing it, a new value opposite the value of impurity came into existence in Shinto.

sen.j: これが「国家神道」である。
sen.e: That is the 'State Shinto'.
That is the 'State Shinto'.
That is the 'State Shinto'.

sen.j: 明治以前の神道における穢れの基準は「延喜式」に詳しい。
sen.e: The details of the standard of impurities before Meiji period is written in 'the Engishiki' (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).
sen.cmt: 「「延喜式」に詳しく記されている。」と解釈しました。
sen.e: The details of the standard of impurities before Meiji period is written in 'the Engishiki' (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).
The details of the standard of impurities before Meiji period is written in 'the Engishiki' (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).

sen.j: 用例
sen.e: Examples
Examples
Examples

sen.j: 忌み嫌う
sen.e: Imikirau
Imikirau
Imikirau

sen.j: - 穢れを払う＋嫌う。
sen.e: - Expel impurities + Hate.
- Expel impurities + Hate.
- Expel impurities + Hate.

sen.j: 穢れを払う様に嫌う。
sen.e: Hate as if to expel impurities.
Hate as if to expel impurities.
Hate as if to expel impurities.

sen.j: 忌み名
sen.e: Imina
Imina
Imina

sen.j: - 清楚＋名。
sen.e: - Neat + Names.
- Neat + Names.
- Neat + Names.

sen.j: 清楚な名・神仏となった本当の名。
sen.e: Neat names. Real names which became Shinto and Buddhist deities.
Neat names. Real names which became Shinto and Buddhist deities.
Neat names: real names which became Shinto and Buddhist deities.
sen.cmt: 二文を一文にしました。

sen.j: （臣下、目下のものが口外するのを忌むべき）本名（諱）。
sen.e: Real names (which it is a taboo for the subjects or lower ranking people to call).
Real names (which it is a taboo for the subjects or lower ranking people to call).
Real names (which was a taboo for the subjects or lower ranking people to call).
sen.cmt: it 削除is→was （今は違うので）

sen.j: 忌中
sen.e: Kichu (ki (忌) + chu (period))
sen.cmt: ローマ字表記のみではなぜ用例なのかが読者にはわからないと判断し、括弧内に"忌"の漢字を加えました。
sen.e: Kichu (ki (忌) + chu (period))
Kichu (ki (忌) + chu (period))

sen.j: - ケガレの最中。
sen.e: - The period of muck.
- The period of muck.
- The period of muck.

sen.j: 奈良時代の忌部氏（いんべし。後の斎部氏）は宮中の神事を行っていた。
sen.e: During Nara period, Inbe clan (忌部氏, later 斎部氏) administered Shinto rituals in the Imperial court.
sen.cmt: 括弧内の説明文には漢字をそのまま使用しました。
sen.e: During Nara period, Inbe clan (忌部氏, later 斎部氏) administered Shinto rituals in the Imperial court.
During Nara period, Inbe clan (忌部氏, later 斎部氏) administered Shinto rituals in the Imperial court.

sen.j: 忌（いん）は清楚という意味でもあるが、平安時代以降はほとんどの場合否定的な意味に使用される。
sen.e: Although in (忌) also means neat, it is used in negative sense in most cases after Heian period.
sen.cmt: Row 55 と同様の理由で括弧内に"忌"の漢字を加えました。
sen.e: Although in (忌) also means neat, it is used in negative sense in most cases after Heian period.
Although in (忌) also means neat, it is used in negative sense in most cases after Heian period.
